app.alert.security.group: To set up access mechanisms to the instance, you need to configure the Security Group in the
app.alert.keypair: We recommend using Keypair to ensure security for your servers. Instructions for using Keypair for your server can be found
app.alert.keypair.next: The login password for the server will be automatically generated and sent to your email when the server is successfully created
app.alert.block.storage: For applications requiring large storage, customers should use external hard drives to ensure data integrity and easy scalability
app.alert.network: The IP address provided by the Internet service provider to the household or business router for connecting to the Internet
app.alert.start.instance: Are you sure you want to turn on the instance?
app.alert.shutdown.instance: Are you sure you want to turn off the instance?
app.alert.reboot.instance: Are you sure you want to reboot the instance?

app.alert.attach.to.vlan: If your network has multiple subnets, please select a subnet and enter the IP you want to assign to the instance. When entering the IP, please choose an IP not yet used by any instance, and this IP belongs to the IP range configured in the corresponding subnet
app.alert.detach.from.vlan: Each connection from an instance to the corresponding VLAN is assigned 1 IP. Choose an IP from the list below to disconnect the instance from the VLAN
app.alert.unrescue.instance: Are you sure you want to UNRESCUE the instance?
app.alert.delete.instance.next: , please enter the instance name to confirm
app.alert.delete.instance.warn: This action will permanently delete data on the system and
app.alert.reset.instance.password: If the OS is Linux, the system will reset the password for the root account. If the OS is Windows, the system will reset the password for the Administrator account
app.tooltip.instance.name: The instance name does not include Vietnamese accents, spaces, or special characters (except _)
app.tooltip.instances.from.snapshot: Customer can create an instance from an existing snapshot to restore the instance to the state when the snapshot was created
app.tooltip.instance.OS: The operating system used to initialize the instance
app.tooltip.volume.type: For each type of volume, the IOPS levels and features will vary
app.tooltip.instance.ip.public:

app.tooltip.use.lan.network: When using LAN network, the instance will be equipped with an additional LAN IP
app.tooltip.access.method.instance: Customer can use a password or keypair to access the instance
app.tooltip.usage.time: The period of time a customer purchases an instance for use, calculated on a monthly basis
validation.exist.instance.name: This instance name has already been used, please choose another name
validation.password.pattern: The password must contain at least 12 characters, including digits, uppercase letters, lowercase letters, and special symbols
validation.correct.instance.name: Please enter the correct instance name
validation.password.new.required: Please enter the new password field

validation.password.confirm: The passwords do not match, please try again
validation.password.confirm.required: Please enter the confirm password field
app.health.monitor.name: Health Monitor name
app.member.name: Member name
app.hdd.intro.text: The better choice if you're dealing with data backups, data storage, or heavy workload throughput
app.ssd.intro.text: The better choice for data analysis workload or gaming
app.volume.name: Volume name
app.alert.volume.of.instance: Please note that, in cases where checking inside the instance displays the hard drive type as Hard Disk Drive (HDD), however, in reality, the instance is stored on an SSD partition to ensure maximum performance and access speed
app.network.name: Network name
app.object.storage.intro: Unlimited, secure, fast, and stable storage
app.object.storage.intro.desc: Supports multiple services and is compatible with popular programming languages ​​such as Python, Java, NodeJS... Supports both long-term and short-term data storage.
app.bucket.name: Bucket name
app.config.access.bucket.private: Limit access to only users with AccessKey and SecretKey.
app.config.versioning: Versioning Configuration: Configure to store all data in the Bucket with different versions
app.note.versioning: Note: Storing multiple versions may increase storage capacity on the Bucket
app.bucket.policy.intro: Bucket Policy is a set of access policy options available to grant permissions (Allow / Deny) for Simple Storage resources, using JSON-based access policy language
app.bucket.policy.intro.next: You can add additional constraints or specific conditions to the Bucket Policy with the Add Condition operation
app.bucket.cors.intro: The CORS configuration limits access to the Bucket
app.static.web.hosting.intro: Configure the Bucket to function as a WebServer for static websites
app.static.web.hosting.intro.next: The bucket only contains static website data: HTML, CSS, JS, images...
app.file.static.web.hosting: The file containing the content for the homepage of the website can be accessed at the following Endpoint link
app.file.static.web.hosting.error: The file containing the error display content of the website
app.note.static.web.hosting: Note: To ensure the website functions, make sure the file has been made public
app.lifeCycle.config.intro: Bucket Lifecycle allows you to manage the lifespan and automation of objects within buckets.
app.lifeCycle.config.intro.next: With Bucket Lifecycle, you can define automatic rules for objects in your bucket, including deleting objects that have expired or are no longer needed to reduce storage costs. Using Bucket Lifecycle also helps reduce administrative workload and increase the availability of objects in the bucket.
app.lifeCycle.text.input2: Date - From Date of Becoming Old Version
app.lifeCycle.note: Note: You can only apply either a "Prefix" or "Tag" filter. To use both, you need to create a new filter
validation.bucket.name: The Bucket name can only use lowercase letters a-z, numbers 0-9, hyphens (-), and periods (.), with a minimum of 3 characters and a maximum of 63 characters
app.alert.resize.object.storage: When increasing Object Storage capacity, the new cost will be calculated from the adjustment date until the expiration date
app.alert.delete.object.storage: Are you sure you want to delete the Object Storage?
app.alert.delete.bucket.next: , please enter the Bucket name to confirm
app.alert.bucket.private: Only users with permissions are allowed access
app.alert.bucket.public: Everyone can access Bucket information, regardless of object permissions. The Bucket is public, but if an object is private, it cannot be accessed from outside
app.alert.bucket.policy.create: This user's Access keys will have access to your Bucket
app.alert.delete.policy: Are you sure you want to delete the Policy?
app.alert.delete.cors: Are you sure you want to delete the CORS configuration?
app.kafka.intro-text: VNPT Message Streaming for Kafka is a data distribution platform for cloud-based systems. Kafka provides fast, stable, and fault-tolerant processing capabilities for Pub/Sub systems.
app.service.duration-placeholder: Please enter the duration of usage
app.kafka.name: Kafka name
app.kafka.create.cancel-body: Are you sure you want to stop creating the Kafka service?
app.kafka.create.note: Note: The entered information will not be saved.
app.kafka.delete-content-1: Are you sure you want to delete the Kafka service
app.kafka.delete-content-2: To confirm deletion, please enter the service name in the box below.
kakfa.topic.name: Topic name
kafka.topic.partition-tooltip: The number of partitions for the topic
kafka.topic.replica-tooltip: The number of times a piece of data will be copied and stored on different brokers
kafka.topic.test-producer-message-valid: The message count is a positive integer between 1 and 100
kafka.topic.test-producer-value-valid: The value is required and cannot exceed 500 characters
kafka.topic.delete-msg: Are you sure you want to delete all messages of the Topic
kafka.topic.delete-content-1: Are you sure you want to delete the Topic
kafka.topic.delete-content-2: Please enter the name of the Topic to delete.
kafka.acl.delete-content: Are you sure to delete the ACL of
kafka.acl.host-note: The default value 0.0.0.0 means allowing connections from anywhere.
kafka.log.note: The system only keeps logs for the recent 30 days.
tooltip.kakfa.topic.max-message-bytes: The maximum size of one message
tooltip.kakfa.topic.min-insync-replicas: The number of in-sync replicas (including the leader) currently being synchronized
tooltip.kakfa.topic.unclean-leader: Enables or disables the ability to elect a leader when the leader broker loses connection with some replicas
tooltip.kakfa.topic.compression-type: Data compression method when pushing into the topic
tooltip.kakfa.topic.leader-replication: The list of replicas of the leader partition that the user wants to limit the replication speed from the leader to. Control or manage the replication speed for specific replicas
tooltip.kakfa.topic.message-downconversi: Parameter indicating whether the system allows automatic down-conversion of data when it is sent from the Producer with a higher protocol version down to a lower protocol version to meet the requirements from the Consumer
tooltip.kakfa.topic.delete-retention: The minimum time a message will be retained in a partition (in milliseconds) before being deleted
tooltip.kakfa.topic.segment-jitter: The parameter defining a random time interval added to the time of creating a new segment in the log. This random time interval helps prevent all partitions in the broker cluster from creating new segments at the same time, distributing the load and reducing the load on the broker
tooltip.kakfa.topic.flush: The minimum time interval between data pushes from the producer to the broker
tooltip.kakfa.topic.follower-replication: Specifies the list of replicas that the Kafka Broker limits the replication speed from the leader to
tooltip.kakfa.topic.segment-bytes: The maximum size for a segment of the log on the broker (in bytes)
tooltip.kakfa.topic.flush-messages: This setting allows specifying a time interval at which data will be forced to fsync to the log
tooltip.kakfa.topic.retention-ms: The minimum time a message will be retained in a partition (in milliseconds), a value of -1 indicates an unlimited time
tooltip.kakfa.topic.message-format: The Kafka protocol version used for the producer and consumer. Misconfiguring this parameter can lead to the Consumer using an old version that cannot use the data
tooltip.kakfa.topic.max-compaction-lag: The maximum time a message will not qualify to participate in the log compaction process. Only applies to logs that are being compacted. After compaction, the system retains only the latest value of messages with the same key
tooltip.kakfa.topic.file-delete: The delay time before deleting a file from the filesystem
tooltip.kakfa.topic.message-timestamp: Specifies how Kafka handles message timestamps
tooltip.kakfa.topic.min-compaction: The maximum time a message will not qualify to participate in the log compaction process. Only applies to logs that are being compacted. After compaction, the system retains only the latest value of messages with the same key
tooltip.kakfa.topic.preallocate: Determines whether the system should preallocate space for the segment before writing data
tooltip.kakfa.topic.min-cleanable: Determines the minimum ratio of dirty (uncompacted) data to clean (compacted) data that Kafka retains before performing compaction
tooltip.kakfa.topic.index-interval: The size of an entry in the index file of a segment (in bytes)
tooltip.kakfa.topic.retention-bytes: The maximum number of bytes a partition can retain before old data is deleted, a value of -1 indicates unlimited capacity
tooltip.kakfa.topic.segment-ms: The maximum time a segment of the log can exist before creating a new segment, a value of -1 indicates unlimited time
tooltip.kakfa.topic.message-timestamp-di: The maximum time limit between the timestamps of producer messages and the timestamps of messages when written into the system
tooltip.kakfa.topic.segment-index: The maximum size for an index file of a segment (in bytes)
validation.service.name-required: The service name cannot be empty
validation.service.name-length: The service name should be between 5 and 50 characters
validation.service.name-pattern: The service name can only include lowercase letters, uppercase letters, numbers, and the characters _ and -
validation.kafka.broker-required: The number of brokers cannot be empty
validation.kafka.duration-required: The duration of usage cannot be empty
validation.kafka.topic.name-required: The Topic name cannot be empty
validation.kafka.topic.name-pattern: The Topic name can only include letters, numbers, and special characters -
validation.kafka.topic.name-length: The Topic name must be between 5 and 255 characters long
validation.kafka.topic.replica-length: Replication factor value is between 1 and 3
tooltip.kafka.numPartitions: Configure the maximum number of partitions a topic can have when it is created. Each partition is a part of the topic and contains a portion of the data. Partitions help Kafka distribute and process data efficiently
validation.kafka.numPartitions-length: The value of num.partitions is a positive integer in the range of 1 to 100
tooltip.kafka.replicationFactor: Configure the default number of replicas for a topic when it is created
validation.kafka.replicationFactor-lengt: The value of default.replication.factor is a positive integer in the range of 1 to 3
validation.kafka.replicationFactor-inval: The value of default.replication.factor needs to be greater than or equal to min.insync.replicas
tooltip.kafka.minInsyncReplicas: Specify the minimum number of replicas of a partition that the producer needs to wait for acknowledgment from before considering the message as safely written
validation.kafka.minInsyncReplicas-lengt: The value of min.insync.replicas is a positive integer in the range of 1 to 3
validation.kafka.minInsyncReplicas-inval: The value of min.insync.replicas needs to be less than or equal to default.replication.factor
tooltip.kafka.offsetTopicReplica: Configure the default number of replicas for the '__consumer_offsets' topic; this topic stores information about the offset of consumers, helping to track the reading position of each consumer in each partition
validation.kafka.offsetTopicReplica-leng: The value of offset.topic.replication.factor is a positive integer in the range of 1 to 3
tooltip.kafka.logRetentionHours: Configure the retention time for logs of partitions in Kafka; this setting determines how long log data will be retained before being deleted. The value -1 indicates no limit
validation.kafka.logRetentionHours-lengt: The value of log.retention.hours is an integer in the range from -1 to 2,147,483,647
tooltip.kafka.logSegmentBytes: Configure the maximum size of each segment in the log of a partition; logs in Kafka are divided into segments for efficient data management and deletion
validation.kafka.logSegmentBytes-length: The value of log.segment.bytes is a positive integer in the range from 1 to 10,737,418,240 (10GB)
